title: Manchester City v Aston Villa betting odds: Goal fest likely
text:
Manchester City return to Premier League action as they continue their pursuit of Liverpool but host a confident Aston Villa side determined to put up a fight

City hungry for goals

Manchester City come into the game on a high after hammering Atalanta 5-1 in the Champions League in midweek.

The win maintained City’s 100 per cent record in this season’s competition, Raheem Sterling and Sergio Aguero both getting on the scoresheet with a hat-trick and brace respectively.

The goalscoring form of both players will play a major part in determining whether City can catch runaway Premier League leaders Liverpool.

Pep Guardiola’s men have already scored 42 goals in all competitions this season with Sterling and Aguero contributing 22 of them.

Betfred have Aguero to score any time at 7/2 while Sterling is 12/1 to score another hat-trick.

Villa going for three in a row

Aston Villa seem to be enjoying life in the Premier League despite being one of the favourites for the drop at the start of the season.

Dean Smith’s side go to the Etihad off the back of two wins, against Norwich and Brighton, and will fancy their chances of causing one of the biggest shocks of the season.

Traveling to the home of the champions will not be easy but Villa have shown they love to attack and have only failed to score twice this season.

City operate on a different level to almost every other Premier League team but shock defeats against Norwich City away and Wolves at home can give the Villains hope.

Betfred have Villa to win at 20/1 while Aston Villa and Both Teams To Score is 40/1.

City’s mood decides the game

Manchester City have had an inconsistent season to say the least.

The loss against Wolves, due in no small part to Adama Traore’s inspired performance, showed that Pep Guardiola’s side are vulnerable on the break while the defeat at Norwich suggested they may be finding it more difficult to break teams down this season - something that appeared to come so easily last term.

However, they did manage to beat Brighton 4-0 and Watford 8-0 as well as put five past a very capable Atalanta team.

City will be looking to make a statement against Villa and Paddy Power are offering Over 3.5 Goals at 4/7.

City the kings of corners

As ever, City are likely to have the majority of possession and fly out of the blocks on the attack.

After going a goal down against Atalanta, they had six corners while in their previous game, against Crystal Palace, they won seven.

Even in the loss to Wolves, City won nine corners and over 11.5 corners overall against Villa is 17/20 with Paddy Power.
description: Betting preview as Manchester City return to Premier League action as they continue the chase of Liverpool but host a confident Aston Villa side.
